Hi Tim,

Thanks for waiting!
In order to fully fix the vulnerability, you will need to upgrade the EPP clients as well.
Are you using an MDM tool to install the clients on your endpoints?

Best regards,

TextBody:
Hi Tim,

In that case, when you deploy the new agent, the following is the parameter you need to add to the msiexec command: "INSTALL_OUTLOOK_EXT=0"

For example: "msiexec /i EPPClientSetup_6.2.1.2001.msi WSIP=demo.endpointprotector.com INSTALL_OUTLOOK_EXT=0" as an atribute

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000CNl2b:ref

There is also an Internet Explorer & Lotus Notes Add-ons, is an additional flag needed to remove these 2 add-ons?

What version do we need to update the agents to? Most of our environment is still 5.9.2.8; what should we expect from our clients on this version, will we lose functionality?
Subject: Netwrix Support Ticket #413295 - ADV-2024-002

TextBody:
Hi James,
Netwrix has received reports that following the deployment of CoSoSys Endpoint Protector Hotfix #1 the system may cease to process certain events. Netwrix has confirmed this behavior and is working on a revision to Hotfix #1 to resolve this issue. As a precaution, Netwrix has temporarily paused distribution of the hotfix until a replacement is available.
Customers who have deployed Hotfix #1 and are experiencing an issue with processing events should contact the Netwrix support team.
Regarding the agents, please let me know what your server version is.
Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval.
